definitions.title: n.m.
definitions.body: heel, footprint, hinderpart (Arab. 9aqiba heel, fig. end (of a month), 9iqbah;un mark, sign, trace; Aram. [[עִקְבָּא]], 9qev he3l, footprint, fig. trace, mark (cf. Wsd Wis 2:4 SyrVer Sir 13:26 HCT SyrVer), also end, extremity);—´[[ע]] abs. Ge 3:15 +, cstr. [[עֲקֵב]] Ge 25:26, pl. cstr. [[עִקָבֵי]] Ct So 1:8, [[עִקְּבֵי]] Ge 49:17, Ju Jdg 5:22, [[עִקְּבוֹת]] Ps 77:20, Ps 89:52, etc.;—

definitions.title: a.
definitions.body: heel, of man, Ge 25:26 [[וְיׇדוֹ אׂחֶזֶת בַּעֲקֵב אָחִיו]], as obj. of attack from behind, Ge 3:15 [[וְאַתָּה תְּשׁוּפֶנּוּ עָקֵב]], Job 18:9 [[פַּח]] ´[[יאׁחֵז בְּע]], Je 13:22 [[נֶחְמְסוּ עֲקֵבָָיִךְ]] are treated violently, i.e. are rudely exposed (‖[[נִגְלוּ שׁוּלַיִח]]); as instrument of attack, Ps 41:10 ´[[הִגְדִּיל עָלַי עָ]] hath made great the heel against me, i.e. given me insidiously a great fall (fig. for taken some cruel advantage of me; cf. u(poskeli/zw ); of an animal, Ge 49:17 [[הַנּשֵׁח עִקְּבֵי סוּם]], Ju Jdg 5:22

definitions.title: b.
definitions.body: mark of heel, footprint, Ct So 1:8 [[חְאִי־לָח בְּעִקְבֵי הַצּאׁן]], Ps 56:7 [[יִשְׁמְרוּ עֲקֵבַי]] they mark my footprints, i.e. watch me insidiously wherever I go Ps 89:52 [[אֲשֶׁר]] [[הֵֽרְפוּ עִקְּבוֹת מְשִׁיחְֶָ]] i.e. followed him mockingly, of ´[[י]] (fig.) Ps 77:20 [[עִקְּבוֹתֶי ְלאׁ נוֹדָָעוּ]] thy footprints were not known (the waters closing over them).

definitions.title: c
definitions.body: hinder-part, rear (of a troop of men), Ge 49:19 :[[וְהוּא יׇגוּב עָקֵב]] (rd. [[אָשֵׁר]] :[[עֲקֵבָם ]]) he will troop on their rear, Jos 8:13 [[עֲקֵבָם]] (cf. Di).
